intro: Kochummenia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered kochummenia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are clustered in cymes. Kochummenia parviflora is often found in rocky or limestone-rich soils and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native region.
